about_the_game:
Dark Moon Deities is a PvP auto battler with an emphasis on strategy as well as dynamic spells and effects. Units are able to specialize upon ranking up, allowing you to tech into countering your opponents or create insanely powerful combinations. Many abilities in the game apply Force, which may send enemies flying off the board and into the abyss...

Ascending the Auto Battler

  • Knock Out! Go beyond the chess board with powerful spells and abilities that may send enemies flying off the grid.



  • Items: Units are able to attune to different items that allow them to bridge the gap between Devotions, creating powerful combinations that you may not think to be possible. Make your Warriors into Assassins, your Beasts into Undeads, your Archers into Elementals... the possibilities are endless!



  • Specialization: Heighten the power of your unit's Devotions when ranking up. They are granted one specialization point to allocate as you see fit. Use this in order to shore up weaknesses in your draft, or go all out and acquire an effect that combines with your other effects in some unspeakable way.



  • Graphics: This game takes full advantage of Unreal Engine 5's lighting and VFX to provide an immersive, next-gen experience.



  • Online Ranking System: Coming soon!
  • Chaos Garden: Coming soon!

name: Dark Moon Deities

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit version 1909 revision .1350 or higher, or versions 2004 and 20H2 revision .789 or higher
  • Processor: Quad-core Intel or AMD, 2.5 GHz or faster
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DirectX 11 or 12 compatible graphics card with the latest drivers
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 5 GB available space

short_description: Dark Moon Deities is a deeply strategic auto battler that can be played online vs. other players or offline against bots. Go beyond the grid with forceful spells. Subjugate the Old Gods in order to make their power your own. Bring forth nascent dark moon deities by stealing fragments of their power.
